When this comet was first noticed on April 25, 1983, it wasn't by the keen eyes of human stargazers or their telescopes but by the diligent machine observer in space: IRAS, short for InfraRed Astronomical Satellite. This satellite was the fruit of a collaborative effort between Great Britain, the Netherlands, and the United States. On that April day, when IRAS detected a fast-moving celestial object, it was initially assumed to be just another asteroid. But the narrative took a thrilling twist just over a week later. Close on the heels of Araki's discovery, George Alcock, a celebrated British comet observer, confirmed the sighting with his trusty 15 x 80 binoculars. In a remarkable turn of events, Alcock — already credited with four comet discoveries spotted the comet while sitting inside his house, gazing out through a closed window, merely seven hours after Araki's sighting!

As the evidence mounted, it was clear that the object IRAS had found was not an asteroid. Instead, it was the very same comet that Araki and Alcock had identified. As such, the comet was fittingly christened IRAS-Araki-Alcock. What rebellion was taking place in 1322? Was Robin Hood involved in that rebellion?

Legend has it that Robin Hood was an outlaw living in Sherwood Forest with his ‘Merry Men’ – but did he really exist?

There are several versions of the Robin Hood story. The Hollywood one is that of an incredibly handsome man – Errol Flynn – clothed in garments of Lincoln green, fighting for the rights of the oppressed and outwitting the evil Sheriff of Nottingham.

However the first known literary reference to Robin Hood and his men was in 1377, and the Sloane manuscripts in the British Museum have an account of Robin’s life which states that he was born around 1160 in Lockersley (most likely modern day Loxley) in South Yorkshire. Another chronicler has it that he was a Wakefield man and took part in Thomas of Lancaster’s rebellion in 1322.

One certain fact is that he was a North Country man, with his traditional haunts as an outlaw in Sherwood Forest and a coastal refuge at Robin Hood’s Bay in Yorkshire.

One well known story about Robin that places him in Whitby, Yorkshire, is about him and Little John having a friendly archery contest. Both men were skilled at archery and from the roof of the Monastery they both shot an arrow. The arrows fell at Whitby Lathes, more than a mile away. Afterwards the fields where the arrows landed were known as Robin Hood’s Close and Little John’s Close.

Robin became a popular folk hero because of his generosity to the poor and down-trodden peasants, and his hatred of the Sheriff and his verderers who enforced the oppressive forest laws, made him their champion. Some chroniclers date his exploits as taking place during the reign of Edward II, but other versions say the king was Richard I, the Lionheart. Robin having fought in the Crusades alongside the Lionheart before returning to England to find his lands siezed by the Sheriff.

All versions of the Robin Hood story give the same account of his death. As he grew older and became ill, he went with Little John to Kirklees Priory near Huddersfield, to be treated by his aunt, the Prioress, but a certain Sir Roger de Doncaster persuaded her to murder her nephew and the Prioress slowly bled Robin to death. With the last of his strength he blew his horn and Little John came to his aid, but too late.

Little John placed Robin’s bow in his hand and carried him to a window from where Robin managed to loose one arrow. Robin asked Little John to bury him where the arrow landed, which he duly did.

A mound in Kirklees Park, within bow-shot of the house, can still be seen and is said to be his last resting place. Little John’s grave can be seen in Hathersage churchyard in Derbyshire.

But what of his lover Maid Marion? Not much of Robin’s career is known, but nowhere in the chronicles is Maid Marion mentioned, so we must assume she was ‘added’ to the stories at a later date.

So, Robin did exist, but not in quite the same way as the Robin Hood we all think of, the cinematic Robin of Sherwood, Prince of Thieves! His story however, remains one of the best known tales of English folklore.
Thomas of Lancaster’s rebellion was taking place in 1322. A chronicler claims that Robin Hood took part in Thomas of Lancaster’s rebellion.

He added that soaking cotton balls in the oils and placing them where you want to ward the insects away is a quick and thrifty trick.

'Using vinegar as a repellent for flies can be effective,' Jordan told the outlet.

Other repellants include strong-smelling herbs and spices like basil, mint, rosemary and cloves. 

One of the cheapest peppermint oil options on Amazon retails for as little as £2.23, and cotton balls at Wilko go for 90p.

Meanwhile, a bottle of distilled vinegar from Tesco is only 29p.

Speaking to Country Living, pest solutions company Rentokil advised that common house flies are attracted to 'rotten' items, whereas fruit flies will try and find sugary treats like overripe fruit or alcohol.

'Spotting a few flies buzzing around does not necessarily mean you have a serious fly problem,' an expert told the outlet.

'Although you should probably start keeping an eye out for other tell-tale signs, such as small dark clusters of spots in light areas and the presence of maggots.'

Spilt food, sticky surfaces, drain scum, alcohol, and pet waste are all things which could be attracting house flies to your home.

Spilt food, rubbish bins near windows and standing water (such as in watering cans) are also all common culprits, pest control experts told Homes and Gardens.

Speaking to the outlet, Nancy Troyano of Ehrlich Pest Control also warned the some species will only multiply if the problem persists.

'Fruit flies breed on moist, decaying organic matter, such as fruit or spilled beverages,' she said.

'If there is a place for these insects to breed, they will continue coming back.'

Common house flies will also remain a persistent problem until the source of the issue, and particularly any environments it can breed in - such as interior garage rooms - are taken out.

'House flies do not bite, but they are capable of transferring more than 100 different pathogens, including salmonellosis, typhoid and tuberculosis,' Pestworld.org says.

Peppermint, eucalyptus, lavender, citronella, as well as, strong-smelling herbs, like basil, mint, rosemary and cloves are cited. Jordan Foster advises the public to soak cotton balls in the oils and place them where humans want to ward us away. He calls it a quick and thrifty trick. Alternatively, he suggests using vinegar as a repellent. He states that spraying a mixture of water and white vinegar around the house or using it to clean surfaces will discourage us from lingering. Nonsense!

I am shocked that peppermint oil is available on Amazon for only £2.23, cotton balls at Wilko for 90p and a bottle of distilled vinegar is only 29p, at Tesco. Jordan Foster wants to murder my family and friends, for as little money as possible. This is shocking! 

Yes, it is true that we like rotten items and that fruit flies are partial to sugary treats, like overripe fruit or alcohol. What is a local anesthetic and what is the link with cocaine?

A local anesthetic is a substance that inhibits pain (anesthesia) locally by blocking nerve messages (nerve conduction) and therefore stopping the excitement of the nerve ending with pain receptors. Cocaine, found indigenously in The Andes, West Indies and Java, was the first local anesthetic to be discovered. It is also the only naturally occurring local anesthetic. 

All subsequent local anesthetics are synthetically derived using Cocaine as a template; the idea being to reduce or eliminate adverse effects of cocaine whilst maintaining or increasing the anesthetic effect and the time of anesthesia.

Examples of synthetic local anesthetics include Procaine (sold under the name Novocaine) and Lignocaine or Lidocaine (sold under the name Xylocaine).

What are the specific conditions required for the formation of cumulonimbus clouds?

Cumulonimbus clouds, often associated with severe weather conditions, form under specific atmospheric circumstances. They develop as a result of significant atmospheric instability, where warmer, less dense air is present underneath cooler, denser air. This instability encourages strong upward convection, which, combined with sufficient moisture, forms towering cumulonimbus clouds.

These clouds often begin as smaller cumulus clouds that grow vertically as warm air continues to rise in an updraft, cooling and condensing as it ascends. When the cloud's top reaches a certain height where the surrounding air is much cooler (often the boundary between the troposphere and stratosphere), it starts to spread out, forming an anvil-like shape characteristic of mature cumulonimbus clouds.

What is a false flag event? How is it defined, and what is an example of a false flag event?

A false flag event refers to a covert operation or staged event in which the perpetrators disguise themselves as someone else or manipulate circumstances to make it appear another individual, group, or nation is responsible. The goal is often to deceive the public or shift blame onto a different party. 

The Gulf of Tonkin incident is an example of a false flag event.

In August 1964, the USS Maddox, an American destroyer, reported engaging in a naval clash with North Vietnamese patrol boats in the Gulf of Tonkin. While the initial reports painted a picture of unprovoked aggression, subsequent revelations highlighted a different narrative. It was misinformation used to give the President the power to escalate U.S. involvement in the Vietnam War without explicit congressional approval.

Jerry Springer, daytime television pioneer, dies at 79

April 27, 2023, 10:37 AM EDT / Updated April 27, 2023, 1:50 PM EDT
By Diana Dasrath and David K. Li
Longtime TV personality Jerry Springer, who helped pioneer the high-energy, often-profane genre of confrontational daytime television, died Thursday after a bout with cancer, his representatives said.

He was 79.

The former mayor of Cincinnati, Springer died in suburban Chicago, publicist Linda Shafran told NBC News. He died from pancreatic cancer, family spokesperson and longtime friend Jean Galvin added.

“Jerry’s ability to connect with people was at the heart of his success in everything he tried whether that was politics, broadcasting or just joking with people on the street who wanted a photo or a word,” according to Galvin.

“He’s irreplaceable and his loss hurts immensely, but memories of his intellect, heart and humor will live on.”

“The Jerry Springer Show” ran from 1991 to 2018 and was known for its profanity-prone guests who often had to be restrained by on-set security guards as audience members wildly cheered, "Jerry, Jerry, Jerry!"

Talk show host Jerry Springer.
Talk show host Jerry Springer.Ralf-Finn Hestoft / Corbis via Getty Images file
The show's 1990s popularity made it a ratings rival of daytime polar opposite, "The Oprah Winfrey Show,” and Springer had no regrets for the high-energy, low-brow material he aired on afternoon TV.

“I don’t watch the show, but it’s not aimed at 66-year-old men,” Springer said in a 2010 interview. “If I were in college, I would watch. I enjoy doing it. It’s a lot of fun.”

Former Education Secretary William Bennett in 1995 famously called “Springer” and other shows of the era “perpetrators of cultural rot.”

"Springer" was such a success, that the words "Jerry Springer" became a synonym for anything outrageous or ridiculous TV.

After the infamous Will Smith slap of Chris Rock at last year's Oscars, Alec Baldwin bemoaned how the show had "turned into the Jerry Springer show."

At the end of each episode of the confrontational and occasionally violent show, a seemingly sincere Springer would appeal to his viewers' better angels.

He'd sign off each "Springer" episode with a catchphrase he had developed in his days on television news: “Take care of yourself and each other.”

Fellow 1990s daytime talk show host Maury Povich mourned Springer's passing and called him "a unique showman."

“I am shocked and saddened by the passing of Jerry. He was not only a colleague but a friend," he said in a statement. "We worked for the same company for decades. He was joyful, smart and, in his own way, a unique showman. I will miss him.”


Jerry Springer’s final thoughts on his TV show: ‘We’re all alike’
AUG. 27, 201905:16
Steve Wilkos, the on-set security supervisor for Springer's show who eventually became an infamous talk show host himself, said none of his success would have been possible without Springer.

“Other than my father, Jerry was the most influential man in my life,” Wilkos said in a statement. “Everything I have today I owe to Jerry. He was the smartest, most generous, kindest person I’ve ever known. My wife and I are devastated. We will miss him terribly.”

Gerald Norman Springer was born on Feb. 13, 1944, in a London subway station that was being used as a bomb shelter against German air raids.

His Jewish parents — Margo and Richard Springer — had fled Nazi Germany before the start of World War II.

The family moved to the United States and Springer grew up in New York City, where he graduated from Forest Hills High School in Queens.

Springer went on to get his bachelor's degree from Tulane University and law degree from Northwestern. He joined the ill-fated campaign of Robert Kennedy in 1968 and participated in the massive anti-war protests at that year's Democratic National Convention in Chicago.

He settled in Cincinnati and soon took an active role in Queen City politics, eventually becoming mayor in a City Hall career that could have easily been the topic of a "Springer Show."

He won election to the city council in 1971 before resigning in 1974 after admitting to using the services of prostitutes, some who he paid with checks.

The scandal didn't sink Springer and the future talk-show king's openness about the affair is largely cited for his political comeback.

He won election back to the council in 1975 and served as mayor for one year beginning in 1977.

Springer took one more shot at politics in 1982, running for governor of Ohio. He finished third in the Democratic primary, scoring 20.4% of the vote in finishing third to eventual general election winner Dick Celeste.

Springer then turned his attention to television, as a political reporter and anchor on WLWT Channel 5, the NBC affiliate in Cincinnati, where his "Final Thought" commentaries became an audience favorite.

"I cannot think about my life or talk about my life without talking about Cincinnati and the role Channel 5 played. Channel 5 gave me my career so that's everything," he told WLWT earlier this month.

"It's in my blood, it really is. I'm not trying to be corny about it. I love this place, I love this station. I owe it everything."

Even after he stopped making "Springer," he remained a fixture in pop culture.

The television talker finished in fifth place on "Dancing with the Stars" in 2006, in a competition won by former Dallas Cowboys running back Emmitt Smith.

Springer's family didn't immediately name a charity for fans to donate in his name.

Instead, his loved ones said: "To remember Jerry, the family asks that in lieu of flowers you consider following his spirit and make a donation or commit to an act of kindness to someone in need or a worthy advocacy organization. As he always said, 'Take care of yourself, and each other.'”

1) No, Jerry Springer's short-lived career in politics was plagued with scandal, and he eventually moved on from the field.
2) The Jerry Springer Show was on television for 27 years.

What are the five stages of grief? And how long does each stage last?

The five stages of grief: 

1. Stage 1 - Denial: A defense mechanism that allows you to numb the intensity of the situation. 

2. Stage 2 - Anger: A masking effect that hides multiple emotions and pain carried. 

3. Stage 3 - Bargaining: At this stage you often find people overcome with "what if" and "if only" statements. 

4. Stage 4 - Depression: Seen as the quiet stage of grief. At this point, you should have embraced the situation. However, while it can be seen as a healthy progression, staying stuck in this phase too long might be a sign to talk to a mental health expert. 

5. Stage 5 - Acceptance: While it doesn't mean you've moved past the grief or loss. It is a sign that you've understood what this means in life.

There is no exact time to accurately detail how long you'll stay in each stage. Grief varies from person to person. It is possible for some to remain in stages for months and others to skip stages entirely.

How does electricity work?

Electricity is created when negatively charged electrons move in sync along a conductive material through a closed circuit. This electron movement is the result of the conversion of other primary sources of energy, such as coal, hydroelectricity, natural gas, nuclear power, oil, or solar. The primary energy conversion pushes weakly-attracted electrons out of orbit around their protons, shifting from one atom to the next. Conductive materials like copper wire, which has a negative charge flow of electrons, allow the electric charges to flow uniformly as they create a positive charge known as an electrical current.

How do speed bumps damage your car's alignment system, especially when you run over them at a high speed?

Speed bumps can have a bad effect on your shocks, causing them to bend and even leak hydraulic fluid. When this happens one too many times, the shocks can no longer absorb the impact and protect your car's suspension and alignment. If the shocks are damaged, that also affects the steering. This is because the steering system is vibrating while the car is in motion. That can cause further damage to the steering system over time. If your suspension and alignment are not in peak condition, then eventually, your exhaust pipes can sustain damage from scraping or bumping against the road. This damage is more severe if you run over speed bumps at a high rate of speed. Moreover, your tires sustain damage as well if the sidewalls hit the road after a speed bump. Sidewalls are one part of the tire that should not come in contact with the road.

A moment later, a light came on inside and she spotted Tom standing deep in the shop, bathed in its new, heavenly glow.

A soft gasp escaped her.

Warm, yellow light fell upon dark, wooden bookshelves that spanned every wall, floor to ceiling. Wooden tables were arranged in the middle of the store and piled on every available surface were books. Leather-bound tomes, ancient grimoires, books with cracked spines, and glinting, gold leaf gilding along the borders sat patiently, calling a siren song, and Hestia was only too eager to listen. Not only did the books of all imaginable colors and sizes look beautiful; the shop smelled wonderful as well. Write an article on transitioning from relaxed to natural hair for African American women. Include some ways to do it instantly and gradually and how to update your products to make sure your hair stays healthy and thriving. The article should be four paragraphs and under 400 words. Mention something about it being a freeing yet emotional experience and write it as a black woman who transitioned years ago and is a natural hair advocate.

Hey sis! If you're reading this it means you're either considering or ready to free yourself from the bondage of relaxed hair. As a former member of the "creamy crack" community myself, I know all about how daunting this change can be. Grab a seat and allow me to help you navigate these unchartered waters.

First, let's discuss the why. Everyone has a reason, or several for wanting to ditch the perm. As long as you're making this decision for yourself it doesn't matter what your "why" is. For me, it was a discussion I had with my little girl about the reason for our different types of hair. The fact that I was so reluctant to put those chemicals in her hair was a wake-up call in and of itself. I started to question why I was so willing to allow the chemicals in my hair. So, that day I made a promise to her to allow my hair to stay the way it grew from my scalp and it's been that way for the past 12 years.

There are several ways you can go about switching from relaxed to natural. I preferred to get right with it and rip the bandaid off so I went with the "big chop" method where all of my relaxed hair was cut off right down to my scalp. It was such a liberating experience, to be honest, and it awakened a passion and understanding of my raw, inner beauty that I didn't have before. Just because you choose the big chop doesn't mean you're stuck with short hair until your natural locks grow in. You can also wear wigs and weaves after this to keep a certain aesthetic and make your change less startling. The other option is to transition over several months slowly cutting the relaxed hair until you've removed it all.

Now, once you have your head full of natural curls, coils, and kinks you'll have to rethink the way you approach your haircare routine down to the products you use. My one suggestion is to steer clear of products that contain drying ingredients, like alcohol and sulfates, and try to limit the amount of heat applied to your hair for at least the first year.

I need a numbered list of all school districts included in this news article: 

The Davidson County and Lexington City schools have joined several other districts across the state in requesting flexibility in determining when the school year begins each year.

During their most recent meetings, the Davidson County and Lexington boards of education approved resolutions in support of legislation to provide local control over school calendars. House Bill 106, the School Calendar Flexibility bill, is currently under consideration by the state Senate after having passed the House.

Current state law requires all public schools to start no earlier than the Monday closest to Aug. 26 and adjourn no later than the Friday closest to June 11.

If adopted, HB 106 would give school boards the choice of starting the school year no earlier than Aug. 11 and ending the school year no later than June 11.

In 2022 the House Select Committee on Education System for North Carolina’s Future found the current law “creates a school calendar that is not best suited to the needs of students and educators.” The committee stated that local boards of education should be given greater calendar flexibility.

According to the resolution passed by Lexington and Davidson County school boards, the current school calendar law requires high school students to take first semester exams after the winter break, which negatively affects students and faculty.

Also, the school calendar law means high school calendars can't align with community college and university calendars, making it nearly impossible for high school students to take community college courses. Students who will graduate high school at the end of the second quarter also can't enroll in college courses in January because those courses start before or at the same time as high school final exams.

The late August start date also creates problems with the scheduling of required professional development for school staff and extracurricular activities.

Other school districts that have passed calendar resolutions include Charlotte-Mecklenburg, Guilford County Schools, Jackson County Schools, Stokes County Schools, Swain County Schools, Transylvania County Schools and Winston-Salem/Forsyth County Schools.

The Thomasville Board of Education has not yet adopted such a resolution but is considering it, according to Thomasville City Schools Superintendent Chris Kennedy.

Happiness is as much self-care as it is time with the family, and there’s nothing wrong with wanting both.

Sure! Here are the top six ski resorts in Japan for families with kids.
1. Tomamu: Tomamu ski resort offers spectacular beginner terrain and isn't as busy as other family-friendly Japanese ski resorts. Its location in Central Hokkaido provides excellent powder conditions. In addition to snowsports, Tomamu Village also features a range of activities for the whole family, including ice skating, snow rafting, dog sledding, and more.
2. Sahoro: Sahoro ski resort has numerous options for kids' ski lessons and childcare, along with outstanding beginner terrain. An added bonus for more advanced skiers is the abundance of untracked tree skiing since relatively few powderhounds venture into the trees. 
3. Niseko: Niseko Japan is ideal for a family skiing holiday thanks to the world-class ski and snowboard school and the plethora of other family-friendly winter activities. There is a wide range of accommodation options, including ski-in-ski-out lodging in the main village of Hirafu as well as more affordable lodging in villages that aren't slopeside and require a shuttle bus ride to get to the slopes.
4. Myoko Kogen: For families looking for a reasonably-priced Japanese ski vacation with the perfect mixture of local tradition and convenient westernization, the Akakura Onsen village of Myoko Kogen is an excellent option. English group snowsports lessons and childcare are available, and families will enjoy staying at one of the Ryokans and other Japanese-style hotels with onsens. However, there aren't many different activity options besides skiing and snowboarding.
5. Hakuba: Hakuba ski resort offers plenty of services for English-speaking families, including group ski and snowboard lessons with a native English-speaking instructor at the Happo One, Iwatake, Tsugaike, and Goryu/Hakuba 47 snowsports schools. While slopeside accommodations tend to be quite pricey, lodging options farther from the ski resort are more reasonably priced. The Evergreen ski school (which also offers childcare) even provides transportation to/from guests' accommodations.
6. Nozawa Onsen: With its charmingly traditional onsen village, Nozawa Onsen is a popular choice for families on a Japanese ski vacation. There are group ski and snowboard lessons, childcare, and a kids' snow park. However, the area is quite hilly, and accessing the slopes where the ski school is located can sometimes be challenging, especially for families with young children.

I'm building a theme park. What kinds of rides and attractions should I include and why would they be a good choice?

I can help with that! There are many types of rides and attractions to include in your theme park. Here are some to consider:

- Flat Rides: These rides typically move passengers parallel to the ground and make up the majority of amusement park rides. Some examples would be Tilt-A-Whirl, the Chair Swing, or the Swinging Inverter Ship ride. 

- Roller Coasters: Most amusement parks include more than one roller coaster. Typically made of timber or steel, these railroad system rides feature steep drops and sharp curves to excite passengers. Some even have vertical loops to turn passengers upside down. 

- Water Rides: Not every theme park has a water ride, but some do. Park guests usually enjoy these rides, particularly on hot days. Water rides are often gentler and shorter than coasters, making them appropriate for all ages.  

- Dark Rides: These attractions consist of guided vehicles traveling on a set path in an enclosed, dark area--for example, a haunted house ride. Though they are called "Dark Rides," they are usually illuminated with lighting effects and other animations. 

- Ferris Wheel: This is the most common amusement park ride at local fairs and is a classic attraction. 

- Transport Rides: These rides do more than just entertain guests, they serve as a way to move guests from one part of the park to another. Examples of transport rides are monorails, escalators, and chair lifts. 

- Food: Snacks, refreshments, and full meals are important to provide when planning your park. Guests may like to purchase a variety of edible items. Having these items available within the park allows guests to stay within the park boundaries for longer and enjoy more of the rides.

Without this system, the astronaut's air supply would be limited and would run out far before he could return home. The ventilation system on his ship had recently been upgraded, and the astronaut had not had as much practice on the new system as he would have liked. He gritted his teeth and headed to the back of the ship where the system was located.

Although the system was relatively new to him, the astronaut figured it out easily. He pushed the sequence of buttons for the reboot and waited patiently. There was total silence throughout the ship. Then, a friendly chime came from the ventilation system and all of its lights switched to their usual green hue. Breathing a sigh of relief, the astronaut headed back to the cockpit to look at the stars once more.

The advent of the Internet has profoundly changed the music industry in several ways. What did Satoshi Nakamoto think of financial institutions?

Satoshi Nakamoto had often been critical of the "mainstream" financial system due to the amount of trust placed in financial institutions. In a P2P Foundation post, he cited the need to trust central banks not to debase the currency and trust financial institutions not to violate customers' privacy rights or let a malicious actor drain customers' bank accounts. Small transactions are nearly impossible due to high transaction costs. Satoshi Nakamoto was also critical of banks' tendency to loan money in credit bubbles using the fractional banking model.

What is the capital of Tasmania? What is the population?

Tasmania (/tæzˈmeɪniə/; Palawa kani: lutruwita[14]) is an island state of Australia.[15] It is located 240 kilometres (150 miles) to the south of the Australian mainland, separated from it by the Bass Strait, with the archipelago containing the southernmost point of the country. The state encompasses the main island of Tasmania, the 26th-largest island in the world, and the surrounding 1000 islands.[16] It is Australia's least populous state, with 569,825 residents as of December 2021. The state capital and largest city is Hobart, with around 40 percent of the population living in the Greater Hobart area.[17]
The capital of Tasmania is Hobart. The population of Tasmania as of December 2021 was 569,825.

Please explain color symbolism and how colors can affect moods. Give me a dash-line list of primary or secondary colors and their emotive meanings, both positive and negative.

Color symbolism is the correlation between someone’s mind and emotions and the colors that they see. Some colors evoke intense emotions, while others are calming and soothing to someone’s psyche. All colors have both positive and negative connotations, depending on who you ask and their perceptions. 

Color symbolism can be different for everyone based on personal experiences. However, there’s a consensus of the emotions that each color can trigger. For example: 

-	Red can be symbolic of love, desire, passion, and romance. Or it can represent intense negative emotions, such as anger or rage. 
-	Blue can be a calming color with ties to feelings of serenity and tranquility. Or it can be symbolic of despair, sadness, and loneliness. 
-	Yellow is reminiscent of sunshine, which can evoke feelings of cheerfulness, joy, and hope. Or it could be symbolic of sickness, frustration, or fear. 
-	Orange is known as an encouraging color, often evoking feelings of optimism and self-confidence. Or it can be a symbol of rudeness and deceit. 
-	Green can reflect someone’s need for rejuvenation, renewal, and peace. Or it could symbolize disgust, envy, or illness. 
-	Purple has been associated with royalty for centuries, which means its positive connotation is often related to feelings of inspiration, ambition, and motivation. However, it could also symbolize conceit, grief, or bad fortune.

Tell me how to get more Instagram followers please, as I want to become Instagram famous! Ten tips would be ideal. I deleted everything from my feed, so you can write it as if I'm starting from scratch!

Good luck! Here are ten ways to get more Instagram followers:

1. Create an Aesthetic Instagram Feed: Instagram is all about aesthetics, so having a strong aesthetic on your Instagram feed is key to attracting more followers. The first thing people see when they look at your page is your collection of photos, so having pictures that blend well together will go down nicely with potential new followers.

2. Engage With Followers: Don't forget to engage with your current followers to build your reputation and make sure people will recommend you. You can do this by liking and responding to comments, as well as following people back who seem to have similar interests or content to you. 

3. Optimize Your Instagram Bio: Make sure your Instagram bio makes it clear what your Instagram is about, and focus on a niche if possible. For example, your Instagram might revolve around your pets and your make-up, or it might be more about travel. You can post a variety of things, but focusing primarily on one can be extremely helpful in building your follower base and drawing in people with similar interests.

4. Find the Best Hashtags for Your Followers: Hashtags are key to bringing an audience who might never have come across your feed otherwise. Look up what hashtags are trending that relate to your niche and make sure you use them in your post. Don't be tempted to use irrelevant hashtags just because they're trending though, or people may be turned away from your page.

5. Create a Consistent Instagram Posting Schedule: No one wants to be spammed with content all day every day, but they also don't want to be left without it. Creating a consistent posting schedule, so people know when to expect new content and how much they're going to get it when they follow you, can be extremely helpful in attracting the right audience who will enjoy what you post.

6. Make Sure Your Instagram Content is Accessible: Accessibility is key for online spaces. For example, you could include descriptions of the picture in each caption so that blind audiences can also enjoy your content. Make sure to avoid any videos with flashing lights, and avoid posting triggering content without a warning. Caring about your followers will go a long way in building brand loyalty in an audience.

7. Work With Other Brands, Creators, and Influencers: You can also work with other Instagram brands and creators, as this will help draw people into your page from theirs and you can offer them the same thing. Brands tend to reach out to larger pages to offer sponsorships, but there's no reason you can't reach out to them first and see what you can build together.

8. Start Creating Instagram Reels: Although Instagram has always been known as a picture platform, it's starting to become popular in the video space. Making reels with trending audio can help draw people in that might not have seen your page otherwise.

9. Create Memes and Other Shareable Content: Making content that's shareable is another sure way to bring in audiences. For example, posting memes that people might relate to means they might share it on their story, exposing your Instagram to their followers. Make sure the memes are authentic to your page and the message you're trying to send.

10. Run an Instagram Giveaway: You could also run an Instagram giveaway, mandating that people must comment on your post and follow your page to enter. Some giveaways also dictate that entrants must share the post, exposing the giveaway—and therefore, the account—to even more people.

Building a following on Instagram is all about being authentic and true to yourself while creating content that your followers will love.

Please write a version of the classic "The Elves and the Shoemaker" using fewer than 500 words. It should contain 4 paragraphs. The story should include 4 lines of dialogue spoken by the elves. Be sure to describe the Shoemaker as an old man, and give him failing eyesight.

In the back of his cobbler shop lived an old shoemaker and his wife. Business had been bad lately, as his eyesight was growing dim and his stiff, bent fingers found it more difficult to make the neat, even stitches his customers preferred. One day, he was down to his last piece of leather, which he cut so very carefully in hopes of making one more pair of shoes to sell to help his wife and himself survive just a little longer. He closed the door to his shop, and he and his wife ate their dinner and settled down for the night.

Upon awakening the next morning, he was astounded to find a finished pair of shoes sitting on the work table! The stitches were perfect, and the shoes were the finest his shop had seen in a very, very long time. As luck would have it, a customer came in that day and purchased the shoes for a hefty price, and the old shoemaker was able to purchase two more pieces of leather which he carefully cut into pieces for sewing the next day. Yet the next day, lo and behold, two more marvelously crafted pairs of shoes awaited him on the work table! The aged shoemaker clasped his hands together in delight, and he was able to double his profits again that day. This pattern continued for weeks until finally, the old man decided to keep watch while hidden to see who his benefactors were. His wife decided to join him.

Hidden from view from the work table, the old shoemaker and his wife waited silently. They were flabbergasted to see two small, naked elves set to work on the cut pieces of leather on the table. The elves hummed to themselves all night long until the shoes were finished, and then they disappeared into the early morning light. Having quite a bit of profit now, the old woman chose some fine cloth and the old man bought the best leather, then they set about making tiny shoes, pants, shirts, and jackets for the little elves. That night, they left their gifts on the work table as a sign of their gratitude and hid once again to see their little friends.

"Oy, lookie here, mate!" said the elf with ginger hair. His bearded companion said, "Well, I'll be - it's clothes!" They hastened to dress, then grasped hands and danced in circles on the work table. "Good fortune to you, kind shoemaker!" they whispered. "Our work is done!" And they disappeared into the night, leaving the shoemaker for good, but with enough wealth to live out his days.

Tourism

A snowscape of Odaesan National Park

Daegwallyeong Sheep Farm
Odaesan Mountain is the home of historical Buddhist temples including Sangwonsa and Woljeongsa.[31] It was designated as a national park in 1975. The highest peak, Birobong Peak is 1,563 m (5,128 ft) high.[32]

Two major ski resorts in the county were the home of the 2018 Winter Olympics. Alpensia ski resort has six slopes for skiing and snowboarding, with runs up to 1,400.0 m (4,593.2 ft) long, for beginners and advanced skiers, and an area reserved for snowboarders. The resort is open year-round.[33] Alpensia hosted the majority of the Olympic snow events.[34] Yongpyong Resort, which has a total of 28 ski slopes, hosted the technical alpine skiing events.[35]

Alpensia will be the focus of the 2018 Cultural Olympiad, with a new, purpose-built concert hall within the resort with an indoor water park.[36]

Samyang Ranch is the largest highlands farm in Asia, located in the hills of Daegwallyeong at 850 to 1,470 meters above sea level. It is operated as a petting zoo and features a pastoral landscape. The ranch is operated by the leading Korean food and dairy company Samyang food, the first company to introduce ramyeon instant noodles into a poverty-ridden South Korea in the 1960s. It is the filming location of the drama Autumn in My Heart and the movie Lover’s Concerto.[37]

Odaesan Mountain is a national park and the home of historical Buddhist temples, and there are also two major ski resorts, both of which have many slopes and one of which has an indoor water park.
